column4: Microsoft hit with patent lawsuit over LED smartphone technology
column5: An inventor-owned patent licensing entity sued Microsoft on Tuesday  saying the Redmond  Washington-based company's flagship smartphone infringes on patents relating to light-emitting diode (LED) technology.

column4: Tencent-backed search firm Sogou jumps 10 pct in U.S. market debut
column5: Nov 9 China-based Sogou Inc's shares rose more than 10 percent in their U.S. market debut  as investors expect a massive base of Chinese smartphone users to help the Tencent-backed search engine company narrow the gap with market leader Baidu.

column4: Chipmaker Nvidia tops estimates on gaming  data center boost
column5: Nvidia Corp's  quarterly profit and revenue topped market estimates and the chipmaker also gave a strong revenue forecast for the current quarter  powered by demand for its graphics chips used in gaming and data centers.

column4: Breakingviews - Apple has deciding vote in Broadcom-Qualcomm deal
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Apple may anoint the winner of Broadcom's $105 billion bid for Qualcomm. A dispute over iPhone royalties left the U.S. chipmaker vulnerable to an opportunistic offer from its acquisitive rival. Settling could preserve Qualcomm’s independence – but it all depends on whether Apple thinks a bigger Broadcom would be slavishly devoted to the handset maker  or just surlier.

column4: Factbox: China-U.S. commercial deals signed during Trump's China visit
column5: BEIJING U.S. companies  from chip giant Qualcomm to aircraft maker Boeing  announced a slew of deals on Thursday during U.S. President Donald Trump's visit to Beijing. The deals could be valued as much as $250 billion  though some have been long in the pipeline and many are non-binding.

column4: Qualcomm signs $12 billion in China deals amid Trump visit
column5: BEIJING Qualcomm Inc  has signed $12 billion worth of deals with three Chinese mobile handset makers on the sidelines of a state visit to Beijing by U.S. President Donald Trump.

column4: BRIEF-Qualcomm signs MoU with Xiaomi  Oppo and Vivo as part of a bilateral trade mission
